q: MUSIC mogul Simon Cowell has confessed he learnt nothing at school. Instead he taught himself and relied on`` instincts'' to amass a Â£ 165million fortune. He said: I never really had a proper education. I wasn't born with any skill. I didn't learn anything from school.`` Mainly, I trust my instincts because I have very broad tastes.`` I believe if I like something, other people are going to like it as well. The 50-year-old actress- who plays scathing cheerleading coach Sue Sylvester on the US TV show- believes there are many similarities between the teacher and the straight-talking talent show judge. She said: If ever there was a guy who tells it like it is, then it's Simon Cowell . You could definitely look at Sue and say there's a lot of Simon Cowell in her.`` He's a great inspiration for the character of Sue- there is a lot that I can take from him and put into her. Eric Schmidt , previously CEO of Novell and CTO of Sun Microsystems, has by far the most enterprise experience in the triumvirate that runs Google, which also includes co-founder Sergey Brin . Eric Schmidt clearly had passion for enterprise software, says Gartner analyst Whit Andrews.`` He cared about enterprise software. He worked at a lot of companies that sold enterprise software and bunch of enterprise products. That history is not in place with Page.''
